title.native: おおきく振りかぶって

description:
After a falling out with his middle school team, Mihashi enters Nishiura high school with no social skill, a warped opinion of himself, and every intention to quit baseball. The newly formed Nishiura baseball team, however, needs a pitcher, and they welcome him. Most enthusiastic is Abe, a domineering catcher with his own game issues.

And so a battery every bit as complementary as it is dysfunctional is formed. If they can figure out how to work together, they might be the answers to each other's problems-and the team might be able to win.

node.description:
__Cousin:__ [Aaron Dismuke](https://anilist.co/staff/95254/Aaron-Dismuke)

__Justin Ryan Cook__ is an American voice actor, producer, line producer, ADR director and enginner who works for FUNimation.

**Birthplace:** Los Angeles, California
**Spouse:** Rachel Robinson (2019-)

**Introduction:**
Christopher Bevins, alternatively known as Chris Bevins is an American voice actor, ADR director and script/screenwriter. He is more known for his work as an ADR director at FUNimation Productions in Dallas/Fort Worth, Texas.

**Non-anime roles:**
~!- Dhalsim and Soldier A (David) in "Street Fighter V" (VG)
- Dhalsim in "Street Fighter IV" (VG)
- Dhalsim in "Street Fighter X Tekken" (VG)
- Koga, Brycen and Swimmer in "Pokémon Masters" (VG)
- Legault in "Fire Emblem Heroes" (VG)
- Nadai in "Fist of the North Star: Lost Paradise" (VG)
- Shishiwakamaru in "Yu Yu Hakusho: Dark Tournament" (VG)
- Voice in "FUNimation" (logo bumper)
!~
**Non-anime staff credits:**
~!- Script Adaptation for "Sengoku Basara: Samurai Heroes" (VG)!~

Yousuke Kuroda is a Japanese screenwriter. He is affiliated with Studio Orphee and serves as the inside director (board of directors member).

Kuroda is a prolific writer in the anime industry. Having authored and scripted numerous anime series. Including several original productions. Some of the most notable are Infinite Ryvius, Scryed, Please☆Teacher!, Mobile Suit Gundam 00, and Waiting in the Summer.

In 2003, he won the Individual Award at the 8th Animation Kobe event.
A Japanese manga artist born in Saitama.

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"

node.description: [*] Junzō Ishida (石田 順三, born 28 February 1981) Plays the piano.  [*] Daisuke Saeki (佐伯 大介, born 28 August 1980) Vocals.  [*]Yūki Tomida (冨田 勇樹, born 13 July 1980) Guitar.

__[Official Site](https://ikimonogakari.com/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCflAJoghlGeSkdz5eNIl-sg)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/IKIMONOofficial)__

__ikimono-gakari__ (いきものがかり) is a Japanese rock band. They record on Sony Music Japan's EPIC Records label.  The band was formed in Kanagawa Prefecture in February 1999 by Hotaka Yamashita and [Yoshiki Mizuno](https://anilist.co/staff/168854/Yoshiki-Mizuno), and was later joined by lead vocalist [Kiyoe Yoshioka](https://anilist.co/staff/159004) in December the same year. Hotaka Yamashita later left the band as of July 2021.
__Hiromi Kikuta__ is a Japanese sound director, who works for the company Rakuonsha.
Also goes by the name J. Isaac Tompkins.

Twitter __Ryou Eguchi__ is a Japanese producer, composer and arranger. He was the producer of the Japanese rock-band School Food Punishment between 2008 until 2012 when the band officially disbanded. He later joined la la larks, with previous members from the band School Food Punishment as their producer.
